courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Fetal Medicine I
courses.description: The aim of this course is to review the basic knowledge of screening and diagnosis related to fetal medicine, as well as the latest relevant knowledge. It includes: [1] Scan in early pregnancy (before 11 weeks), [2] The 11-14 weeks scan, [3] Second trimester scan, [4] Prenatal diagnosis, [5] Pre-conception counselling and counselling for termination of pregnancy. The course also covers genetic counseling, ethics, and ethical dilemmas in genetic testing and intervention.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire the basic knowledge of screening and diagnosis related to fetal medicine, as well as the latest relevant knowledge.
courses.course_syllabus:
[1] Scan in early pregnancy (before 11 weeks)
[2] The 11-14 weeks scan
[3] Second trimester scan
[4] Prenatal diagnosis
[5] Pre-conception counselling and counselling for termination of pregnancy
[6] Genetic counseling, ethics, and ethical dilemmas in genetic testing and intervention
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Fetal Medicine II
courses.description: This course focuses primarily on multiple pregnancies. It includes: [1] Chorioamnionicity and Twin-twin-transfusion syndrome (TTTS), [2] Twin anaemia polycythemia sequence (TAPS), [3] Twin reversed arterial perfusion sequence (TRAPS), [4] Selective fetal growth restriction (sFGR), and [5] Fetal reduction.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, the students will have acquired the ability to be competent in diagnosing
and managing [1] Chorioamnionicity and Twin-twin-transfusion syndrome (TTTS), [2] Twin anaemia polycythemia sequence (TAPS), [3] Twin reversed arterial perfusion sequence (TRAPS), [4] Selective fetal growth restriction (sFGR), and [5] Fetal reduction.
courses.course_syllabus:
[1] Chorioamnionicity and Twin-twin-transfusion syndrome (TTTS)
[2] Twin anaemia polycythemia sequence (TAPS)
[3] Twin reversed arterial perfusion sequence (TRAPS)
[4] Selective fetal growth restriction (sFGR)
[5] Fetal reduction
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Fetal Medicine III
courses.description: This course covers the pathology, diagnosis and treatment of fetal anaemia and in utero transfusion, and amniotic fluid abnormalities.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, the students will have acquired the ability to be competent in diagnosing
and managing fetal anaemia and in utero transfusion, and amniotic fluid abnormalities.
courses.course_syllabus:
[1] Fetal anaemia: common causes and other rare causes
[2] Fetal anaemia and in utero transfusion
[3] Amniotic fluid abnormalities
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Fetal Medicine IV
courses.description: The course covers the pathology, diagnosis and treatment of fetal infection, gestational alloimmune diseases, and medical treatments for preterm fetuses and fetal growth restriction.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, the students will have acquired the ability to be competent in diagnosing
and managing fetal infection, gestational alloimmune diseases, and medical treatments for preterm fetuses and fetal growth restriction.
courses.course_syllabus:
[1] Fetal infection: Fetal cytomegalovirus, and other fetal infections and treatments
[2] Gestational alloimmune diseases
[3] Medical treatment for preterm fetuses (steroids and MgSO4)
[4] Medical treatment for fetal growth restriction
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Maternal Medicine
courses.description: This course serves to teach students comprehensive knowledge in maternal medicine. It covers: hypertensive disorders of pregnancy (HDP), renal disease, cardiac disease, liver disease, respiratory disease, gastrointestinal disease, diabetes, other endocrine diseases, neurological disease, connective tissue disease, haematological disease/VTE, psychiatric disease (including section under mental health ordinance/act), skin disease, neoplastic disease, substance abuse, maternal infection, transplant recipient including immunosuppressant, and maternal mortality including suicide.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on maternal medicine.
courses.course_syllabus:
[1] Hypertensive disorders of pregnancy (HDP)
[2] Renal disease
[3] Cardiac disease
[4] Liver disease
[5] Respiratory disease
[6] Gastrointestinal disease
[7] Diabetes
[8] Other endocrine diseases
[9] Neurological disease
[10] Connective tissue disease
[11] Haematological disease/VTE
[12] Psychiatric disease (including section under mental health ordinance/act)
[13] Skin disease
[14] Neoplastic disease
[15] Substance abuse
[16] Maternal infection
[17] Transplant recipient including immunosuppressant
[18] Maternal mortality (including suicide)
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.

courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Perinatal Medicine
courses.description: This course covers the understanding of perinatal medicine including fetal growth disorders (screening, diagnosis, monitoring, delivery), preterm birth/prelabour rupture of membranes (PPROM), alloimmunisation, and perinatal infection.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on perinatal medicine.
courses.course_syllabus:
[1] Fetal growth disorders (screening, diagnosis, monitoring, delivery)
[2] Preterm birth/prelabour rupture of membranes (PPROM)
[3] Alloimmunisation
[4] Perinatal infection
[5] High risk obstetrics
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.

courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Clinical Genetics
courses.description: Clinical genetics deals with direct clinical care of patients with genetic disease, including diagnosis, management and counselling as well as development of a genomic approach to human diseases in clinical settings which requires the application of all of the basic principles of medical genetics taught in this course. The course will also include genetic counseling, which encompasses basic genetic principles and inheritance patterns, genetic testing techniques in maternal fetal medicine, and genetic counseling for preconception, prenatal, and postnatal stages.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on clinical genetics.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Clinical Cytogenetics
courses.description: The course covers the understanding of DNA and its architecture, cell division and the use of various techniques to examine these structures, including chromosome banding, FISH and array CGH. It also covers the application of these techniques for the detection of chromosomal abnormalities, developing preanalytic and postanalytic skills in test results interpretation, report writing and communication of result to clinicians.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to understand and be able to conduct karyotyping analysis on prenatal and postnatal samples including result interpretation and write up report.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Advanced Clinical Genetics
courses.description: The course covers prenatal dysmorphology and genetic syndromes, the principles of prenatal screening and diagnosis, and psychological, ethical and legal issues in genetic testing in general, impact on risk assessment of hereditary and patient privacy. It will also teach recognisable patterns of human malformation using a combined approach encompassing dysmorphology, formulation of diagnosis, advanced laboratory testing, management and therapy.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on clinical genetics in advanced level.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Literature Review
courses.description: During this course, students will examine the literature related to a specific maternal fetal medicine topic while being guided by a teaching staff, which includes ethical considerations. Regular progress discussions with supervisors are mandatory, and students must submit a written report and deliver a seminar presentation upon completion of the course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes: This course improves studentsâ€™ ability of writing a critical appraisal to published matenal fetal medicine related research paper.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: MFMD
courses.title: Research Project
courses.description: Research topics related to maternal fetal medicine will be selected by the students under the supervision of a teaching staff. The research project will either be a laboratory-based or clinical data-based investigation. Students are required to write up the result in a dissertation and make a seminar presentation at the end of the course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Maternal Fetal Medicine
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to demonstrate competency in the application of research methodologies. In addition, they are able to synthesise and critically evaluate published information and present it in written format.
